react.question: What is the best definition of React.js ?
react.c: A Library for building interaction interfaces

react.question: What is the children prop ?
react.a: A Property that lets you nest components in other components
react.b: A Property that adds child values to state
react.c: A Property that lets you pass data to child components
react.d: A Property that lets you set an object as a property

react.question: How can you optimize performance for a function component that aways render the same way ?
react.d: Wrap it in the React.memo higher-order component

react.question: What is a common use case for ref ?
react.a: To directly access a DOM node
react.b: To refer to another JavaScript file

react.question: React separates the user interface into components. How are components combinded to create a user interface ?
react.b: By putting them in a folder structure

react.question: Which of the following is NOT a rule for React Hooks ?
react.b: Hooks can only be called inside React Function components
react.c: Hooks can only be called at the top level of a component
react.d: Hooks can be called in Class or Function components

react.question: Why should you avoid copying the values of props into a component's state ?
react.a: Because that would create two instances of the same state that could become out of sync
react.b: Because you want to allow data to flow back up to the parent
react.c: Because prop values cannot be stored in state
react.d: Because you should never mutate state
